channel.title: Posts on Shaka Rover
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Shaka Rover

item.title: separate compiled the mdk project
item.description: The ndk project may need to be compiled with a specific version of ndk (ollvm), but it is a bit exaggerated to install the complete Android project compilation environment for this purpose. So I wrote a script specifically for compiling the ndk project. Using this script with docker is more perfect. #!/usr/bin/env bash set -eu ProjectDir=/home/Rover12421/Test/app/src/main/cpp ndkVersion=22.1.7171670 cmakeVersion=3.18.1 Android_SDK_HOME=/home/rover12421/Android/sdk Android_NDK=${Android_SDK_HOME}/ndk/${ndkVersion} CMAKE_DIR=${Android_SDK_HOME}/cmake/${cmakeVersion} abi=armeabi-v7a BuildType=Release AndroidPlatform=23 CmakeOut=${ProjectDir}/build/cmake/${BuildType}/${abi} LibOut=${ProjectDir}/build/${BuildType}/${abi} FLAGS="-Wno-sign-compare" # rm -rf ${CmakeOut} # rm -rf ${LibOut} ${CMAKE_DIR}/bin/cmake \ -H${ProjectDir} \ -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=${BuildType} \ -DCMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE=${Android_NDK}/build/cmake/android.

item.title: About JetbrainsIdesCrack
item.description: JetbrainsIdesCrack is just a temp project. I will post to internal channels if there are updates. But by no means here. So please don’t ask any questions about JetbrainsIdesCrack(update/release/support). Your inquiry will not receive any response. As for the update of JetbrainsIdesCrack, I think it may disappoint you. Please support genuine as much as possible under the conditions.
